productdata.title: Tablets
productdata.details: What is Crocin 650 Tablet used for? Crocin 650 is a well-known and widely used medicine for fever and pain relief. It frequently used to treat low and moderate pain conditions such as headaches, toothaches, migraines, menstrual cramps, and sprains. It is a safe drug and can be used to treat conditions where people must take painkillers for a longer time, such as musculoskeletal pain. How should I take Crocin 650 Tablet? Crocin 650 tablets should be taken orally and swallowed with water. Do not crush, cut, or chew the tablet. Swallow it whole. Do not take more than 4000 mg or more than 6 tablets under 24 hours. Do not repeat a dose before 4 hours. Though it is available as a non-prescription medicine, it is best to consult a doctor if you do not feel better within 3 days. How does Crocin 650 Tablet work? Crocin 650 contains paracetamol and belongs to the group of analgesics (painkillers) and antipyretic (fever reducing) medicines. It eases pain and fever by blocking the discharge of specific chemical messengers. It starts working within an hour and the effects last for 4-6 hours. I missed a dose. What should I do? If you miss a dose, take the next dose when you remember. If it's almost time to take your next dose, skip and continue to take the next dose. Do not take 2 doses to make up for the missed dose. I have taken too much. What should I do? Crocin 650 is safe in most cases and is unlikely to cause any harm if you do not take more than 6 tablets or 4000 mg in 24 hrs. Do not repeat a tablet before 4 hours. If you have taken more than your prescribed dose you may experience side effects including severe liver injury. In such cases, call your doctor or rush to a nearby hospital immediately. What are the substances that should be avoided with Crocin 650 Tablet? Crocin 650 should not be taken with other medicines containing paracetamol as it increases the risk of overdosing and resulting liver damage. It is safe to take with most other medicines including antibiotics and other painkillers which do not contain paracetamol. Do not take Crocin 650 tablet if you are taking medicines to treat epilepsy, tuberculosis or blood thinners such as warfarin. It can be safely used by pregnant and breastfeeding women. When should I consult my doctor after starting Crocin 650 Tablet? After taking Crocin 650-650 your symptoms should improve and you should start feeling better. Your doctor may call you for a follow-up visit to ensure that your condition has improved. If you do not notice any improvement with Crocin 650, or if you experience severe side effects, consult your doctor right away.

productdata.title: Tablets
productdata.details: About P 500 mg Tablet: P 500 mg Tablet belongs to the group of mild analgesics (pain killer) and antipyretic (fever-reducing) medicine indicated to ease mild to moderate pain and reduce fever. Each uncoated P 500 mg Tablet contains Paracetamol 500 mg. Paracetamol exerts analgesic and antipyretic effects by peripheral blockage of pain impulse generation and inhibition of the hypothalamic heat-regulating centre, respectively. It also exhibits weak anti-inflammatory activity by the inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis. Use of P 500 mg Tablet: P 500 mg Tablet is used to ease mild to moderate pain and reduce fever. It is also used for the treatment of conditions including headache, migraine, backache, toothache, menstrual pain, musculoskeletal pain, and common colds. Usage Direction of P 500 mg Tablet  P 500 mg Tablet is intended for oral use only, in a dose and direction as advised by the physician. •P 500 mg Tablet is taken whole with the help of water. • Do not crush, chew or break the tablet. • Do not skip or stop the medicine without the physician's advice. • Do not consume more than the recommended dose. • Before consumption, always go through the leaflet or label instructions that come with the product. Precaution & Related information of P 500 mg Tablet: • If hypersensitive or allergic to P 500 mg Tablet, inform the physician immediately. P 500 mg Tablet should not be used with other Paracetamol-containing products. • The Physician should be well informed when concomitant consumption of this tablet with any other medicines or supplements. • Taking more than daily dose may cause serious liver damage or allergic reactions (e.g. swelling of the face, mouth and throat, difficulty in breathing, itching or rash). . Consult with the physician during pregnancy & lactation. Keep out of reach of children. Storage condition of P 500 mg Tablet: • Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C. productdata.title: Tablets
productdata.details: About P 500 mg Tablet: P 500 mg Tablet belongs to the group of mild analgesics (pain killer) and antipyretic (fever-reducing) medicine indicated to ease mild to moderate pain and reduce fever. Each uncoated P 500 mg Tablet contains Paracetamol 500 mg. Paracetamol exerts analgesic and antipyretic effects by peripheral blockage of pain impulse generation and inhibition of the hypothalamic heat-regulating centre, respectively. It also exhibits weak anti-inflammatory activity by the inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis. Use of P 500 mg Tablet: P 500 mg Tablet is used to ease mild to moderate pain and reduce fever. It is also used for the treatment of conditions including headache, migraine, backache, toothache, menstrual pain, musculoskeletal pain, and common colds. Usage Direction of P 500 mg Tablet  P 500 mg Tablet is intended for oral use only, in a dose and direction as advised by the physician. •P 500 mg Tablet is taken whole with the help of water. • Do not crush, chew or break the tablet. • Do not skip or stop the medicine without the physician's advice. • Do not consume more than the recommended dose. • Before consumption, always go through the leaflet or label instructions that come with the product. Precaution & Related information of P 500 mg Tablet: • If hypersensitive or allergic to P 500 mg Tablet, inform the physician immediately. P 500 mg Tablet should not be used with other Paracetamol-containing products. • The Physician should be well informed when concomitant consumption of this tablet with any other medicines or supplements. • Taking more than daily dose may cause serious liver damage or allergic reactions (e.g. swelling of the face, mouth and throat, difficulty in breathing, itching or rash). . Consult with the physician during pregnancy & lactation. Keep out of reach of children. Storage condition of P 500 mg Tablet: • Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C. Protect from light and moisture.

productdata.title: Tablets
productdata.details: What is Shelcal 500 Tablet used for? Shelcal 500 is a calcium and vitamin D3 tablet. It promotes bone health and reduces the risk of fractures in people with low calcium and vitamin D levels. It is used to treat bone diseases such as osteomalacia and osteoporosis, in which the bones become weak and brittle. How should I take Shelcal 500 Tablet? Take Shelcal 500 tablet through your mouth (orally) and swallow it whole with a full glass of water or milk. Do not cut, chew or crush the tablet or it may not provide the desired results. There is no best time to take a Shelcal 500 tablet. Take it at the same time everyday preferably with or after a meal. Take the dose as mentioned by your doctor in the prescription. Do not take more than the prescribed dose or you may experience severe side effects. How does Shelcal 500 Tablet work? Shelcal 500 works by increasing calcium and vitamin D levels in the body and strengthening the bones. It corrects calcium and Vitamin D deficiency in the body and reduces the risk of fractures especially in older men and postmenopausal women suffering from bone diseases like osteoporosis. I missed a dose. What should I do? If you forget to take a dose, take it as soon as you remember. If your next dose is due soon, skip the missed dose and continue with the next dose at the same time. Do not take two doses to compensate for the missed dose. I have taken too much. What should I do? If you have taken more than your prescribed dose you may experience severe side effects. Call your doctor immediately. What are the benefits of Shelcal 500 tablet? Calcium makes up a major part of the bones and is necessary for maintaining bone strength and normal functioning of muscles and nerves. Calcium cannot be produced by the body and must be obtained from the foods you eat. Vitamin D helps the body absorb calcium in the gut. In addition to sunlight exposure, vitamin D is also produced in the body as a result of the foods we eat. With age, calcium and vitamin D deficiencies become more common, resulting in weak and fragile bones prone to fractures. Shelcal 500 helps maintain the body’s calcium and vitamin D levels, thus promoting bone health. It is used to treat bone diseases such as osteomalacia, a condition in which bones become soft, weak and brittle. It can also be used in combination with other medicines to treat osteoporosis in the elderly and in postmenopausal women. When should I consult my doctor after starting Shelcal 500 Tablet? Your doctor will prescribe Shelcal 500 for a set period of time, after which your symptoms should improve and you should start feeling better. After completing the course, your doctor may ask you for a follow-up visit to ensure that your condition has improved. If you do not notice any improvement after the course has finished, or if you experience severe side effects, consult your doctor right away.

productdata.title: Health Device
productdata.details: Pack Of: 1 Number of content in sales package: 1 N Blood glucose monitoring system + Free 10 Test Strips Product Type: Blood Glucose Monitoring System Packaging Type: Mono-Carton Warranty: 10 Years Product Description: The Accu-Chek Active blood glucose meter is intended to be used for the determination of quantitative blood glucose in fresh capillary blood by reflectance photometry. The Accu-Chek Active blood glucose meter may only be used together with Accu-Chek Active test strips. This easy-to-use system comprises unique features like pre and post-meal markers, visual double check, and 2 buttons intuitive handling. Net Quantity: 1 N Accu-Chek Active meter (with 1 N battery), 1 N Accu-Chek Softclix lancing device, 10 N sterile Accu-Chek Softclix lancets, 1 N user manual, 1 N quick start guide, 1 N carry case, 1 N Accu-Chek Softclix information sheet, 1 N testing guide and 1 N Warranty card. Features: Accurate: Accurate blood glucose measurement Safety & Related Information: If the patient has not applied the blood to the test strip in the available time and the meter has turned itself off, remove the test strip and discard it. Start the test from the beginning with a new test strip. Do not rub the blood drop onto the test field when applying the blood. Do not store used test strips in a test strip container that still contains unused test strips. Do not bend the test strip while sliding it into the meter. Do not bend or move the test strip before or while applying blood or while the test is in progress. Only apply blood to the test strip when the drop symbol is flashing on the display. Discard used test strips according to local regulations. Do not change the therapy without talking to the healthcare professional first. Please inform the healthcare professional immediately, if blood glucose values are too low or too high. Storage Conditions: During storage without battery: -25 to +70°C During storage with battery: -20 to +50°C Keep out of reach of children.

Each 5 ml of Polycrol Xpress Relief contains Magnesium hydroxide 100 mg, Aluminium Hydroxide Gel 5 g, Activated dimethicone 125 mg, Sorbitol (70%). Aluminum hydroxide and Magnesium hydroxide reacts with the stomach acid and form a salt and water. Thus, the pH in the stomach is increased and the acidity caused by the gastric HCl is decreased. Dimethicone in Polycrol mixed with silicon dioxide gives simethicone (activated dimethicone). Activated dimethicone gathers all the small bubbles trapped in the stomach and intestine and later on, helps in releasing them in the form of belching or farts. It prevents entrapment of gas in mucus. Sorbitol acts like a laxative. It softens the stools and eases the excretion through feces. Use of Polycrol Xpress Relief (Sugar free) Gel 450 ml: Polycrol Xpress relief is an antacid gel, neutralizes the acid content in the stomach and gives relief from the burning sensation in the stomach. It helps in neutralizing the stomach acids and eliminates the gas entrapped in the stomach and the intestine. Thus, it helps in reducing acidity and flatulence.

blog-data.title: Sugar - 7 Ways to Eliminate the Sweetest Poison!
blog-data.name: Sugar
blog-data.intro: Eating too much 'added sugar' can cause tooth decay, obesity and premature aging • The World Health Organization recommends limiting sugar intake to 12 teaspoons a day Simple changes, like switching to fruits instead of sweets and reading food labels can help reduce sugar consumption Recent news about the 126-year-old yoga guru who is healthy and kicking despite his age has left people in awe. His alleged secret to longevity? Cutting out the white stuff - sugar, salt, and oil - from his diet. Eating sugar has long been linked to adverse health effects like teeth cavities, accelerated aging, obesity, and lifestyle diseases such as diabetes and blood pressure. Not all sugars are bad for you. Natural sugars found in fruits, milk, and vegetables are safe; the issue begins with added sugars, which manufacturers add to packaged products to improve the taste or shelf life.
blog-data.full: Key Takeaways: • Eating too much 'added sugar' can cause tooth decay, obesity and premature aging • The World Health Organization recommends limiting sugar intake to 12 teaspoons a day Simple changes, like switching to fruits instead of sweets and reading food labels can help reduce sugar consumption Recent news about the 126-year-old yoga guru who is healthy and kicking despite his age has left people in awe. His alleged secret to longevity? Cutting out the white stuff - sugar, salt, and oil - from his diet. Eating sugar has long been linked to adverse health effects like teeth cavities, accelerated aging, obesity, and lifestyle diseases such as diabetes and blood pressure. Not all sugars are bad for you. Natural sugars found in fruits, milk, and vegetables are safe; the issue begins with added sugars, which manufacturers add to packaged products to improve the taste or shelf life. How much sugar intake is OK? Added sugars are practically present in everything we eat, from obvious culprits like chocolates, candies, cakes, cookies, and soft drinks to the unexpected ones like bread, soups, and ketchup. The World Health Organization recommends limiting total sugar intake in adults to 12 teaspoons (50g) of sugar per day. Reducing it further to 6 teaspoons (25g) may be even better for your health. (1). The National Institute of India (NIN) dietary guidelines recommend cutting down on sugar and unhealthy processed foods which contain only empty calories and no health benefits. (2). Ways to eliminate sugar from daily diet!!! (3). (4). Though it may be hard for most people to entirely cut out sugar from the diet, following 7 simple ways can help you minimize your intake. 1. Cut down on tea and coffee: A cup of tea with 2 teaspoons of sugar contains 40 calories and needs about 5 minutes of jogging to burn. It can quickly add up if people drink multiple cups. (5). To begin, cut your sugar intake in half and gradually transition to sugar-free hot drinks or sugar substitutes. 2. Breakfast is the key: If you eat cereal for breakfast, check for whole wheat or bran cereals with no 'added sugar'. Add sliced fruits like bananas or dry fruits instead of sugar. When adding milk, choose a toned or low-fat option. Yogurt with fresh fruits & nuts or scrambled egg with whole-wheat toast could also be a better option. Substitute jam, honey or chocolate with home-made chutneys. 3. Switch to healthier snack options. Start by cutting back on sweet snacks. If you have two biscuits, start by reducing to one or replacing with low sugar, high fiber biscuits or cookies. Swap salted nuts, chocolates or cookies for healthier snacks like puffed rice (murmure), papad, makhana, popcorn or steamed home-made items like idli or rice cakes. 4. Desserts are a big part of being Indian, 'sweetening mouth' after meals, and eating sweets for every happy occasion is ingrained in us from childhood. Change to healthier habits by replacing ghee-laden sugar-heavy desserts for fresh fruit or raisins. Instead of gifting sweets for festivals, go for packaged nuts or dates. (6). 5. Switch from fizzy drinks: A liter of cola contains almost 20 tsps or 100g of sugar and would add 320 calories to your body. Opt for homemade nimbu paani (lemon water), low-fat milk or natural fruit and vegetable smoothies instead. When you are craving a sugary drink, you are often dehydrated and a glass of plain water or buttermilk will work just as well.(Z) 6. Portion control. Cut down the sugar quantity while making sweets or baking cakes to half the amount required. You won't even notice but the amount of sugar consumed will reduce. Try to add spices such as ginger, cinnamon, and nutmeg rather than sugar into your favorite recipes. (6). 7. Shop smart. When shopping at the supermarket, always read the ingredients to assess how much added sugar is in the product. Compare similar products in order to find those with less sugar, less trans fat, and smaller sizes. High-sugar foods contain more than or equal to 22.5g of sugar per 100g of product, while low-sugar foods contain less than 5g of sugar per 100g of product. (3). Harmful effects of added sugar and the way out: (8)(9). With global sugar consumption tripling in the last 50 years, several health issues have emerged. Sugar is a leading cause of tooth decay in both children and adults, and it has been linked to an increased risk of cavities and gum disease. Obesity, heart disease, high blood pressure, diabetes, fatty liver, and even cancer can result from eating too much added sugar. Sugar hastens aging by inhibiting collagen regeneration and turnover, which are features of youthful skin. Harmful effects of added sugar and the way out: (8) (9). With global sugar consumption tripling in the last 50 years, several health issues have emerged. Sugar is a leading cause of tooth decay in both children and adults, and it has been linked to an increased risk of cavities and gum disease. Obesity, heart disease, high blood pressure, diabetes, fatty liver, and even cancer can result from eating too much added sugar. Sugar hastens aging by inhibiting collagen regeneration and turnover, which are features of youthful skin. Sugar reacts with proteins and fats to form AGES, which impair collagen's ability to regenerate, hastening the aging process. (10). (11). Conclusion Be mindful of the health hazards linked with consuming excess added sugar. Modify your food and drink intake and exercise caution while purchasing packed foodstuff. Remember to check the ingredients for sugar levels. Make smart choices to live a healthier and sweeter life!!! This article is written by Ankur Majumdar and medically reviewed by Dr. Malancha Mukherjee

blog-data.title: The Natural Ways Of Building Immunity
blog-data.name: immunity blog-banner-1
blog-data.intro: Immunity is defined as the ability of the human body to recognize, neutralize or destroy harmful foreign micro-organisms such as viruses, bacteria, parasites, fungi that can cause infections. The Immune System is a complex network of cells, tissues and chemicals that fight against infections and kill micro-organisms when the latter invades the human body. This system is basically composed of White Blood Cells which are produced in the Bone Marrow. They are concentrated in the bloodstream, lymph nodes, gastrointestinal tract and other glands and organs within the human body. Causes of a Weakened Immunity: A weakened immunity refers to a state where the performance of the body's immune system is underactive or poor. A person with low immunity can increase the risk of infections & illnesses.
blog-data.full: What is Immunity? Immunity is defined as the ability of the human body to recognize, neutralize or destroy harmful foreign micro-organisms such as viruses, bacteria, parasites, fungi that can cause infections. The Immune System is a complex network of cells, tissues and chemicals that fight against infections and kill micro-organisms when the latter invades the human body. This system is basically composed of White Blood Cells which are produced in the Bone Marrow. They are concentrated in the bloodstream, lymph nodes, gastrointestinal tract and other glands and organs within the human body. Causes of a Weakened Immunity: A weakened immunity refers to a state where the performance of the body's immune system is underactive or poor. A person with low immunity can increase the risk of infections & illnesses. A weakened immunity can be caused due to the following reasons: Stress: People under chronic stress are more susceptible to diseases & illnesses. Stress can increase the risk of other infections. It also delays the recovery process of an illness or injury. Poor Dietary Habits: Poor dietary habits can have a negative impact on the body's immune system. People who usually consume more junk food (that contain free calories in the form of excess sugar, fats like saturated fats, artificial colour, flavour, preservatives etc.) tend to have a weaker immune system. Psychological State: A poor psychological state has an adverse effect on the immunity of a human being. This state can lead to stress which compromises the immune system and makes it harder for it to fight against diseases. Smoking: The effects of tobacco smoke can decrease the levels of antioxidants present in the blood, which is responsible for increased susceptibility to infections and long-lasting illnesses. Sedentary Lifestyle: Jobs that involve sitting for long periods of time on a regular basis and avoiding exercises can affect the ability of the human body to fight infections. A sedentary lifestyle along with inactivity leads to an increased risk of an impaired immune system, inflammation and other chronic diseases. Poor Nutritional Status: Nutritional status of individuals is directly linked with the immune system. Poor nutrition can lead to an inadequate intake of energy and macronutrients (Carbohydrates, Protein & Fat) along with deficiencies of vital micronutrients (Vitamins & Minerals) which are important for proper functioning of the human body. So, the deficiencies of both macro & micronutrients resultin a weakened immunity of the body. Simple Ways to Boost Immunity: The body's immunity can be naturally boosted for it to function properly in the following ways: 1. Dietary Factors: Diet plays a significant role when it comes to strengthening the immune system. Fresh Fruits & Vegetables: Fresh fruits & vegetables provide nutrients (like-Phytonutrients, Antioxidants, Fibres etc.) that promote a better immune response as well as healing and immune- modulating properties. blog-data.full: India is the 'diabetes capital of the world, with nearly 77 million people affected by the condition, and this figure is only expected to rise further. It is believed that the number of people with diabetes will surpass 134 million by 2045. The majority of these cases are of type 2 diabetes, which is becoming more common as a result of unhealthy lifestyles and expanding waistlines. Long standing diabetes can lead to several complications and eventually death. (1). To lower the burden of diabetes, it is imperative to incorporate changes in lifestyle, such as regular exercise and dietary modifications that result in weight loss. Lifestyle interventions focusing on physical activity, healthy eating, and weight loss have shown to reduce the risk of developing diabetes by around 60%.  Who is at risk for diabetes? If you have one or more risk factors listed below, you are at a higher risk of developing diabetes: • Age 35 years or older • Have immediate family members with diabetes • Are overweight/obese (BMI 23 kg/m2) or a have a bigger waistline (males >90 cm, females >80 cm) • Have high blood pressure (hypertension) • Have high cholesterol • Have cardiovascular (heart) diseases • Were detected with prediabetes (HbA1C ≥ 5.7) • Have a sedentary lifestyle (walk less than 5000 steps/day) • Are a woman with polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS) • Are a woman at risk for gestational diabetes (2). How Can You Reduce The Risk of Diabetes? The following lifestyle modification tips can help reduce your risk of getting diabetes. 3) Exercise: Physical activity lowers the risk of diabetes by 20- 30%. Aim for 150 minutes/ week of moderate physical activity such as walking, cycling, or swimming or 75 minutes/ week of vigorous- intensity aerobics, with muscle training on two or more days of the week. (2). 4) Quit Smoking: Smokers are 30 to 40% more likely to develop diabetes than nonsmokers. Cigarette smoke contains harmful chemicals that eventually lead to an increased risk of developing diabetes. These chemicals also reduce insulin's effectiveness in lowering blood sugar levels. (5). 5) Limit Alcohol Excessive alcohol consumption reduces the body's sensitivity to insulin, resulting in diabetes. Alcohol also contains empty calories, which can add to your waistline and increase your sugar levels. (4). 6) Stop Sitting, Start Moving People who have a sedentary lifestyle (less than 5000 steps/day) are at a higher risk of developing diabetes. Being more active not only helps you lose weight, it also improves your cognitive skills and lowers the risk of other lifestyle diseases. (6). 7) Sleep More: Sleeping disturbances have also been linked to abnormal glucose metabolism, and have shown to significantly increase diabetes risk. Sleeplessness causes insulin-producing cells to stop working properly, which increases the risk of diabetes. (Z). 8) Stress Less: Stress releases hormones which can cause your blood sugar levels to rise. Stress also impacts the ability of insulin to work properly and thus, can lead to diabetes. (8). 9) Get some sunshine: Studies show that vitamin D deficiency may result in reduced insulin secretion. When vitamin D levels improve in the body, the functioning of insulin can also improve thus preventing the risk of diabetes. 10) Stay Hydrated: According to research, people who drink one sugary beverage a day have a 26% higher risk of developing diabetes than those who drink less than one per month. Switch to water, coconut water, buttermilk or green tea to keep you hydrated and lower the risk of obesity and diabetes.

blog-data.title: Amla For Your Health
blog-data.name: amla
blog-data.intro: The Indian gooseberry is a fruit that is acknowledged for its nutrient content. Locally known as Amla, it has been a familiar component in the ancient Indian practice of Ayurveda. It's a reservoir of Vitamin C, calcium and iron. This fruit for its versatile properties is famous among the health-conscious masses. Here's how it proves to be useful every time! Checks the process of ageing Amla the superfruit is full of antioxidants that are capable of reducing cell damage. It decreases the consequences of free radicals which are held accountable for damaging DNA, protein and cell membranes. In this way, it efficiently fights the ageing process. Combats heart disease High cholesterol is the principal cause of heart disease. By reducing the build-up of harmful cholesterol, Amla lessens the risk of heart disease. It also diminishes clogging in the arteries by increasing good cholesterol. Studies have also shown its advantages in limiting the thickening of blood vessel walls, the first sign of heart disease.
blog-data.full: The Indian gooseberry is a fruit that is acknowledged for its nutrient content. Locally known as Amla, it has been a familiar component in the ancient Indian practice of Ayurveda. It's a reservoir of Vitamin C, calcium and iron. This fruit for its versatile properties is famous among the health-conscious masses. Here's how it proves to be useful every time! Checks the process of ageing Amla the superfruit is full of antioxidants that are capable of reducing cell damage. It decreases the consequences of free radicals which are held accountable for damaging DNA, protein and cell membranes. In this way, it efficiently fights the ageing process. Combats heart disease High cholesterol is the principal cause of heart disease. By reducing the build-up of harmful cholesterol, Amla lessens the risk of heart disease. It also diminishes clogging in the arteries by increasing good cholesterol. Studies have also shown its advantages in limiting the thickening of blood vessel walls, the first sign of heart disease. Promotes immunity Amla is a steady source of vitamins, antioxidants and contains tannins. Tannins, when coupled with polyphenols, makes the fruit a free radical scavenger. This means that it decreases the damage, free radicals cause to the cells and increases the body's disease-fighting ability. Reduces blood sugar Research has shown that fruits that are rich in polyphenol, protect the body from the oxidative nature of high blood sugar. Amla can thus be therapeutic for people who have diabetes. It also helps in the proper absorption of insulin in the body. In this manner, it decreases the blood sugar levels. Strengthens bones Osteoclasts are the cells accountable for breaking up bones. Amla's high calcium content and its ability to lower osteoclasts is the perfect combination that strengthens bones. So constant consumption of Amla is really good for the bones. Battles cancer As per research, the fruit has 18 compounds that inhibit the progress of gastric cancer, breast cancer and uterine cancer. Amla acts as a natural anti-mutagenic agent. Its chemopreventive properties are able to prevent the proliferation of tumour cells by killing them naturally while also building your immunity. Calcium absorption One of the less-discussed benefits of Amla is that it helps the body positively absorb calcium. Calcium is an essential component of our teeth, bones and nails. It also makes sure that one has lustrous hair. Amla is perfect for hair growth so, eating a Vitamin C-rich fruit like this is a great way to keep your body feeling as well as looking great! Ensures good dental health Amla is a powerful antimicrobial agent. Studies have found that different extracts of amla like methanol, hot and cold water, acetone and ethanol inhibit the growth of Streptococcus mutans bacteria. It had also been found that the acetone and hot and cold water extracts were effective against Staphylococcus aureus. So researchers suggest that amla can be beneficial as a treatment for tooth decay and cavities. Elixir for digestive problems Amla with lemon juice is a refreshing drink, beneficial in stopping acute bacillary dysentery. It pumps antioxidants into the body and keeps it hydrated. The antimicrobial properties of the fruit restore digestive health. The dried amla fruit can also be eaten for easing diarrhoea. Whichever we choose, it must be from a genuine source. Indulge in these dried Amla bites or stir up a lukewarm drink comprising of amlaki powder and honey for taste, to unlock the power of this nutrient powerhouse.

blog-data.title: Is Tingling in Your Hands and Legs Causing Discomfort?
blog-data.name: Painful
blog-data.intro: Feeling tingly in your hands and legs? It can be annoying and make you worry about your health. But don't fret! Understanding why it happens and how to deal with it can make all the difference. In this article, we'll explore the reasons behind those pesky tingling sensations and give you some easy tips to make them go away. So, let's dive in and find relief for that tingling feeling! What causes Tingling Sensations? Tingling sensations in the hands and legs can be due to various factors. Here are some common causes: Causes of Tingling Sensations in Hands and Feet: Nerve Damage or Compression Tingling sensations in the hands and feet can occur due to nerve compression or damage.
blog-data.full: Feeling tingly in your hands and legs? It can be annoying and make you worry about your health. But don't fret! Understanding why it happens and how to deal with it can make all the difference. In this article, we'll explore the reasons behind those pesky tingling sensations and give you some easy tips to make them go away. So, let's dive in and find relief for that tingling feeling! What causes Tingling Sensations? Tingling sensations in the hands and legs can be due to various factors. Here are some common causes: Causes of Tingling Sensations in Hands and Feet: Nerve Damage or Compression Tingling sensations in the hands and feet can occur due to nerve compression or damage. Common causes include: a. Carpal Tunnel Syndrome: Compression of the median nerve in the wrist can lead to tingling, numbness, and pain in the hands. b. Herniated Discs: When discs in the spine become displaced, they can press on nerves, causing tingling sensations in the hands and feet. c. Peripheral Neuropathy: This condition involves nerve damage and can result from various causes, including diabetes, chemotherapy, alcohol abuse, and certain infections. Diabetes High blood sugar levels in diabetes can lead to nerve damage (diabetic neuropathy), resulting in tingling sensations in the hands and feet. Poor Circulation Reduced blood flow to the extremities can cause tingling sensations. Conditions such as peripheral artery disease, where arteries narrow and restrict blood flow, or Raynaud's disease, which causesspasms in blood vessels, can contribute to poor circulation and tingling sensations. Pregnancy Hormonal changes and increased pressure on nerves during pregnancy can lead to tingling sensations, particularly in the hands and feet. Sciatica Compression or irritation of the sciatic nerve, which runs from the lower back down to the legs, can cause tingling, numbness, and pain in the lower back, buttocks, and legs. Vitamin Deficiencies Deficiencies in vitamins such as B12, D, and E, as well as minerals like magnesium, can contribute to tingling sensations in the hands and feet. Infections: Certain infections, such as Lyme disease, HIV/AIDS, and shingles, can cause nerve damage and tingling sensations. Alcohol Abuse Excessive alcohol consumption can result in peripheral neuropathy, where nerves in the hands and feet are damaged, leading to tingling sensations. Other Medical Conditions: There are various other medical conditions that can cause tingling sensations in the hands and feet. These include: 1. Hypothyroidism: An underactive thyroid gland can affect nerve function and cause tingling sensations. 2. Multiple Sclerosis: This autoimmune condition can damage the protective covering of nerves, resulting in tingling, numbness, and other neurological symptoms in the hands and feet. 3. Fibromyalgia: A chronic pain disorder that affects the muscles and soft tissues, fibromyalgia can cause tingling sensations along with widespread pain. How to Stop Tingling Sensations? While addressing the underlying cause is essential, there are steps you can take to alleviate tingling sensations in the hands and legs. Here are some practical tips: 1. Improve Posture: Maintaining good posture can help relieve nerve compression. Use ergonomic furniture, take breaks, and avoid prolonged periods of sitting or standing to reduce pressure on nerves. 2. Exercise Regularly: Engaging in regular physical activity promotes circulation and helps alleviate tingling sensations. Incorporate aerobic exercises, strength training, and stretching into your routine to improve blood flow. 3.Eat a Balanced Diet: Proper nutrition is crucial for nerve health. Consume a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins. Consider foods high in vitamin B12, vitamin D, and magnesium to address potential deficiencies. Consider multivitamin supplements if you are unable to substitute them in your diet. 4.Practice Stress Management: Stress and anxiety can contribute to tingling sensations. Engage in relaxation techniques such as deep breathing, meditation, or yoga to reduce stress levels and promote overall well-being. 5. Apply Warm or Cold Compresses: Applying warm compresses can improve circulation, while cold compresses can help reduce swelling. Alternate between the two to find relief from tingling sensations. When to Worry and Seek Medical Attention? While most cases of tingling sensations are not a cause for immediate concern, there are situations where medical attention is warranted. Here are some indications to seek medical advice: 1. Persistent Tingling: If tingling sensations in the hands and legs persist for an extended period, it is advisable to consult a healthcare professional for a thorough evaluation. 2. Accompanying Symptoms: Seek medical attention if tingling is accompanied by other concerning symptoms such as weakness, numbness, difficulty walking, loss of bladder or bowel control, or changes in vision. 3.Gradual Worsening: If tingling sensations gradually worsen over time or significantly impact your ability to perform daily activities, it is important to seek medical advice promptly. 4. Pre-existing Conditions: Individuals with pre-existing medical conditions like diabetes, multiple sclerosis, or thyroid disorders should be vigilant about any changes in tingling sensations and consult their healthcare provider accordingly. Tingling sensations in the hands and legs can stem from various causes, including nerve compression, poor circulation, nutritional deficiencies, and underlying medical conditions. By understanding these causes and implementing lifestyle changes, such as maintaining good posture, exercising regularly, and consuming a balanced diet, you can effectively manage tingling sensations. However, if tingling persists, worsens, or is accompanied by concerning symptoms, it is crucial to seek medical attention for proper evaluation and diagnosis. Prioritizing your well- being and addressing tingling sensations promptly will help you live a comfortable and healthy life.

blog-data.title: 6 Lifestyle Changes to Manage Your Heart Failure
blog-data.name: Heart attack
blog-data.intro: Heart failure occurs when your heart is unable to pump blood effectively, leading to symptoms of breathlessness, fatigue, and fluid buildup in the legs and lungs. While medicines and medical interventions can help manage heart failure, making lifestyle changes is crucial for long-term improvement and living well with the condition. Here are six lifestyle changes that people with heart failure can make to improve their overall health and well-being. 1. Manage Weight Check your weight in the mornings every day; any sudden weight gain could be a sign of fluid buildup and worsening heart failure. If you gain 0.5 to 1 kg per day or 2-3 kg per week, consult your doctor right away... Obesity is a major risk factor for heart failure and losing weight can improve overall heart health.
blog-data.full: 6 Lifestyle Changes to Manage Your Heart Failure Heart failure occurs when your heart is unable to pump blood effectively, leading to symptoms of breathlessness, fatigue, and fluid buildup in the legs and lungs. While medicines and medical interventions can help manage heart failure, making lifestyle changes is crucial for long-term improvement and living well with the condition. Here are six lifestyle changes that people with heart failure can make to improve their overall health and well-being. 1. Manage Weight Check your weight in the mornings every day; any sudden weight gain could be a sign of fluid buildup and worsening heart failure. If you gain 0.5 to 1 kg per day or 2-3 kg per week, consult your doctor right away... Obesity is a major risk factor for heart failure and losing weight can improve overall heart health. If you have heart failure, losing weight can also reduce the workload on your heart, making it easier for it to pump blood efficiently. Losing even 3-5% of your total weight would help. Weight loss will also help you manage your blood pressure, cholesterol, and other risk factors. Weight loss can be achieved through a combination of diet and exercise, do check with your doctor before starting any weight loss program. 2. Stop Smoking Smoking is a major risk factor for heart disease, and one of the most crucial things that you can do to improve your overall health, if you have heart failure, is to quit smoking.Smoking damages blood vessels and increases the risk of blood clots, making it difficult for the heart pump blood efficiently. Smoke chemicals can raise heart rate and blood pressure, increasing the workload on the heart. Quitting smoking can improve your tolerance for physical activity, reduce the risk of developing other chronic diseases, and improve your overall quality of life. Your doctor can provide guidance on smoking cessation programs and medicine options that can help you quit smoking. 3. Exercise Regularly Daily physical activity is vital for people with heart failure, as it can help improve energy levels, boost mood, lower blood pressure, and improve heart muscle strength. However, it is essential to consult your doctor before starting any exercise program, as certain types of physical activity may not be appropriate for everyone with heart failure. Activities such as walking, swimming, cycling, and yoga can be beneficial for people with heart failure, but it is essential to start slowly and gradually increase intensity over time. Work out at the same time every day to maintain consistency, work up to at least 30 minutes/day 5 times a week or as your doctor advises. Find activities that you enjoy, and exercise with friends and family to keep your motivation going. Your doctor can provide guidance on the types and amounts of exercise that are safe and effective for people with heart failure. 4. Rest and Sleep Well Getting adequate rest is essential for overall health and well-being, but it is critical if you are suffering from heart failure. Rest reduces the workload on your heart and makes it easier for it to pump blood. Sleep is necessary for the heart to rest and repair, and a lack of sleep increases the risk of developing other chronic diseases like diabetes and high blood pressure. People with heart failure should aim to get at least seven to eight hours of sleep per night and talk to your doctor if you are having trouble sleeping. To improve your sleep, try propping your head up with pillows to make breathing easier, and avoid large 5. Manage Stress Stress can have a negative impact on your heart health increasing blood pressure, heart rate, and adrenaline levels, making it harder for the heart to pump blood efficiently. Meditation, deep breathing exercises, and yoga can be helpful in reducing stress levels and improving overall well-being. Talk to your friends and family, develop a hobby such as gardening, and join a support group to keep stress at bay. Count to 10 before responding if you feel angry. Your doctor can guide you on stress management techniques and recommend counseling if you experience significant stress or anxiety. 6. Deal with Depression Depression is common in people with heart failure and can have a negative impact on overall health and well-being. Talk to your doctor if you are experiencing symptoms of depression, such as persistent sadness, loss of interest in activities, or changes in appetite or sleep patterns. Your doctor may recommend medicines, or counseling to beat depression. People with heart failure may also benefit from support groups or counseling to help them cope with the emotional impact of their condition. changes in appetite or sleep patterns. Your doctor may recommend medicines, or counseling to beat depression. People with heart failure may also benefit from support groups or counseling to help them cope with the emotional impact of their condition. In conclusion, making lifestyle modification is crucial for people with heart diseases like heart failure to manage their condition effectively. Eating a heart-healthy diet, exercising regularly, quitting smoking, limiting alcohol intake, managing stress, and getting adequate sleep are all important steps people with heart failure can take to improve their overall health and well-being. Always consult a doctor before making significant lifestyle changes, as certain changes may not be appropriate for everyone with heart failure. With the right care and lifestyle modifications, you can lead fulfilling and healthy lives even with heart failure. Medically reviewed by Dr. Malancha Mukherjee on 27th April 23.
